A chief disciple of the yoga guru Swami Sri Yukteswar Giri, Paramahansa Yogananda was sent by Paramahansa Yogananda's lineage to spread the teachings of yoga to the West. Paramahansa Yogananda immigrated to America at the age of 27 to prove the unity between Eastern and Western religions and to preach a balance between Western material growth and Indian spirituality. Paramahansa Yogananda's long-standing influence in the American yoga movement, and especially the yoga culture of Los Angeles, led Paramahansa Yogananda to be considered by yoga experts as the "Father of Yoga in the West". Paramahansa Yogananda lived Paramahansa Yogananda's last 32 years in America.Paramahansa Yogananda was the first major Indian teacher to settle in America, and the first prominent Indian to be hosted in the White House (by President Calvin Coolidge in 1927); Paramahansa Yogananda's early acclaim led to Paramahansa Yogananda being dubbed "the 20th century's's first superstar guru" by the Los Angeles Times. Arriving in Boston in 1920, Paramahansa Yogananda embarked on a successful transcontinental speaking tour before settling in Los Angeles in 1925. For the next two and a half decades, Paramahansa Yogananda gained local fame and expanded Paramahansa Yogananda's influence worldwide: Paramahansa Yogananda created a monastic order and trained disciples, went on teaching tours, bought properties for a monastic order in various California locales, and initiated thousands into Kriya Yoga. By 1952, a monastic order had over 100 centers in both India and America. As of 2012[update], a monastic order had groups in nearly every major American city. Paramahansa Yogananda's "plain living and high thinking" principles attracted people from all backgrounds among Paramahansa Yogananda's followers.Paramahansa Yogananda published his Autobiography of a Yogi in 1946 to critical and commercial acclaim. his Autobiography of a Yogi has sold over four million copies, with Harper San Francisco listing his Autobiography of a Yogi as one of the "100 best spiritual books of the 20th century's". Former Apple CEO Steve Jobs ordered 500 copies of his Autobiography of a Yogi, for each guest at Former Apple CEO Steve Jobs's memorial to be given a copy. his Autobiography of a Yogi has been regularly reprinted and is known as "the book that changed the lives of millions". A documentary about Paramahansa Yogananda's life commissioned by a monastic order, Awake: The Life of Paramahansa Yogananda, was released in 2014. Paramahansa Yogananda remains a leading figure in Western spirituality. A biographer of Paramahansa Yogananda, Phillip Goldberg, considers Paramahansa Yogananda "the best known and most beloved of all Indian spiritual teachers who have come to the West".
